column1: 63 year old male, no known comorbidities. Fever and non-productive cough. Leucocytosis. Hypoxemic and hypocapnic respiratory failure. Contact with red zone subjects. NCOV positive buffer 19.
Fig. 1 and 2: in the LSD and LID some areas of increased ground glass density are evident. Parenchymal consolidations are evident in both lower lobes, more marked data on the left.

Fig. 3 and 4: control examination 3 days after the previous computed/computerized tomography scan, for clinical worsening. Ground glass alterations in both lower lobes markedly more extensive, with areas of consolidation in the context.
